sentences.english: Sneaking out may seem like a real option in the heat of anger.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，偷偷溜出去看上去似乎是真正的解决之道。

sentences.english: During the depression, I used to hop freights at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 大萧条时期，我一月至少一次要偷偷搭乘货运列车。

sentences.english: Some have to hide eking out a living for decades.
sentences.chinese: 有些老华侨甚至躲藏了数十年，偷偷谋生。

sentences.english: I have friends who, I suspect, secretly scoff at my mild work-out routines.
sentences.chinese: 我疑心有几个朋友偷偷嘲笑我温和的锻炼程序。

sentences.english: Dave or Kathy are not go to steal apart on vacation.

sentences.english: Night, He Junfeng sneaked into the office building, found the document.

sentences.english: He slunk into his parent's room and took the car keys.
sentences.chinese: 他偷偷溜进父母的房间而且拿走了车钥匙。

sentences.english: Wisdom Yin found who had been secretly drinking, a big quarrel two.
sentences.chinese: 智贤发现世拉一直在偷偷的喝酒，两个大吵一架。

sentences.english: You sneak a flask up there and raise a toast to the whole city of New York.
sentences.chinese: 在楼上偷偷拿走一个扁酒瓶，向整个纽约城敬上一杯。

sentences.english: On it came-on, silently and stealthily, to the bed's head.
sentences.chinese: 它走上前来，无声无息偷偷摸摸地摸到了床头。

sentences.english: Lin Pingzhi picked up cassock secretly run away quickly.
sentences.chinese: 林平之捡了袈裟赶紧偷偷跑掉。

sentences.english: I'm thinking, breaking into a building isn't too far outside your wheelhouse .

sentences.english: Sometimes a coot will try and sneak one of its eggs into a neighbor's nest.
sentences.chinese: 有时白骨顶尝试把自己的蛋偷偷放到相邻巢穴中。

sentences.english: A thief eased the old lady of her purse.
sentences.chinese: 小偷偷走了那位老太太的钱包。

sentences.english: LIFE】A Chinese tourist steals a glimpse of the Palace Museum inside Beijing’s Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 一位游客偷偷张望北京紫禁城内的故宫博物馆。

definition: to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously
midnight/in the middle of the night
